text: Mueller report summary won't come today, DOJ & Hill officials say.  AG Barr and DAG Rosenstein are reading over the document here at DOJ HQ as we speak
author: joshgerstein

text: JUST IN: AG Bill Barr is at Justice Department HQ this morning reading the Mueller report, per a DOJ spokesperson. Still no word on precisely when the principal conclusions will be sent to Hill and public but still expected this weekend
author: joshgerstein

text: A major @nbcnews (near) exclusive tonight!
author: joshgerstein

text: Excited to be on @maddow momentarily on a big day: the Mueller report is in. What do we know and what's next.... Tune in (or click over to) @MSNBC
author: joshgerstein

text: It adds that officials are trying to be responsive to reporters' questions. I think it's implied in him concluding his investigation, but people asked. Also there is the question of referred matters and sealed charges which we are still running down.

text: A senior Justice Department official says: "The Special Counsel is not recommending any further indictments." More breaking here:

text: Appeals court rejects TV reporter @SharylAttkisson's appeal in long-running cybersurveillance suit, but one judge faults feds for 'Kafkaesque' stance obscuring who may be responsible for the alleged snooping. En banc petition possible.

text: Seems Huber is here in his capacity not as Hillary investigator but as vice chair of the somewhat obscure Attorney General's Advisory Committee, a group of US attorneys who give policy advice to DOJ HQ.

text: They're presenting Sessions with his Cabinet Room chair.
author: joshgerstein

text: Barr says events like this are a chance about an AG's team and 'official family.' But the Cabinet is supposed to advise the president. At a similar ceremony in 2015 for Eric Holder, President Obama showed up and spoke.
author: joshgerstein

text: Rod stresses that many AGs served shorter terms than Sessions.

text: All-GOP 4th Circuit panel openly hostile to DC/MD emoluments lawsuit against Trump. Upon hearing who'd be handling the appeal, Maryland's AG promptly slapped himself in the forehead. Strongest prospects for emoluments action may now move to the House https://www.politico.com/story/2019/03/19/trump-emoluments-lawsuit-1226687 …
